summary: Nancy P Schultz was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents provided are payroll and certification reports spanning from October 1977 to November 1978. These reports list her name, position, and salary during that period. The documents suggest she was a staff member of the HSCA during its investigation into the JFK assassination.
significance: Nancy P Schultz's significance lies in her employment with the HSCA during its investigation into the JFK assassination. While the specific nature of her role is not detailed in these documents, her presence on the payroll and certification reports indicates her involvement in the committee's operations.
